data.title: Fix OpenGL testcase 'center' uniform error
Basic question: how to create scenes
data.body:
I'm on cocos2d-x v3.6. What is the recommended/supported way to create scenes - specifically when using replaceScene()? 

I used to use the `director->replaceScene(Myscene::createScene())` way from the template, but later when switching to RapidGame (you can find here on Github) it seems that the create() method was incompatible (it crashed in onExit for me) so I changed to the recommended way in RapidGame which is to use `director->replaceScene(new Myscene)` - now I'm worrying about memory issues here because I guess that cocos2d-x has no way of knowing if the dev used new, so it cannot release that memory on its own... (and in fact I am seeing that the destructor is not actually called on my scenes which currently uses this method)

Well looking at the cpp HelloWorld template in 3.6/3.7 it still looks like `director->replaceScene(Myscene::createScene())` **is** the correct way... and that Myscene should have a `static cocos2d::Scene* createScene();` as well as `CREATE_FUNC(Myscene);` defined. Can someone please confirm?

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

Problem with Socket.io emit
data.body:
I have a problem trying to use "emit" for send data to my server.
Connect, disconnect and On functions are working well, but when i trying to send some data to server, nothing is happend, no error log and server do nothing.

I use Socket.io 1.3.6

Sorry for my bad english.

data.title: Add Luabinding conversions for std::map<std::string, std::string>
Add CREATE_SCENE_FUNC Macro
Implement CCDirector#getScreenCenter
data.body:
We often use center coordinates  of screen. For example drawing the background image.

This PR provides the way to get screen center easily.

These methods are inspired by on Kobold2D. (It is an extension of cocos2d-iPhone.)

https://github.com/kobold2d/kobold2d/blob/master/Kobold2D/__Kobold2D__/kobold2d/cocos2d-ext/CCDirectorExtensions.m#L16

milestone.title: v3.7.1
milestone.description:
This version is about to release with Cocos v2.3.2.
The core feature is Skeleton Animation support for Cocos Studio
It will provide Skeleton Animation for TimelineAction, its cpp/json parser, Lua/JS bindings,  web implementation.
